message.content:
Usually blue during a clear day. Thatâ€™s because sunlight (white light) scatters off the atmosphere, and the shorter blue wavelengths scatter more than the others.

Colors can change:
- Sunrise/sunset: red/orange/pink (sunlight passes through more air, longer wavelengths dominate)
- Cloudy/overcast: gray
- Night: dark/black (stars may be visible)

Sometimes, in storms the sky can look greenish-gray.

If you tell me your location and time of day, I can give a more specific guess for the sky color right now.
